textContent:
I want to break the cycle of finding meaning in everyone external to myself. I want to break the cycle of looking for validation outside of myself. I want to break the cycle of using work to be my source of purpose and meaning in life. I want to be loved for who I am, not what I do. 

Gil loves me for who I am, never for what I do. My kids love me for who I am not what I do. My family loves me for who I am not what I do. Jacob loves me for who I am. Chris loves me for who I am. Luke loves me for who I am. Arielle loves me for who I am. 

Because I've been driven by validation I haven't been able to set and uphold boundaries. I've let my focus fo all over the place. And I've created a toxic environment. 
My relationship with Gil and my kids is toxic and a mess. But it's not toxic and a mess because of them. It's toxic and a mess because of me. Because I've focused my whole life on putting work first family second. I've been hot and cold, passive aggressive, inconsistent, inconsiderate and it's created the dynamic Im facing today. 

But what is true in me is that running away from my relationship with Gil is running away from myself. From my own shortcomings and issues. 

I want to continue building a life with Gil and my kids. I want to turn towards them, breaking the cycle of depriotizing them to find meaning in my work. 

I work because 1. We need income, 2. It's extra time I have that doesn't interfere with my family 3. It feels good 

I don't work to gain fulfillment or purpose. My fulfilment and purpose is already inside me. I am worthy. I am enough. I don't need to prove anything to anyone. I am enough just as I am.
